logic

Class StaticBoard

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.Gameboard
      • logic.StaticBoard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PatternLoader

    public class StaticBoard
extends Gameboard
    Initiates a static representation of gameboard. Static means that the board itself is not expanding with the living cells movement.

    • Constructor Detail

      • StaticBoard

        public StaticBoard(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        Constructs a static instance. This object is created with a instance of NextGeneration. This NextGeneration object contains the standard ruleset of Game of Life(B3/S23).
        Parameters:
        gc - gc is the Canvas's GraphicsContext displaying the graphics to the user.

      • StaticBoard

        public StaticBoard()
        Empty StaticBoard constructor. Convinient class to use for testing primitives and array objects, not requiering GraphicsContext.

    • Method Detail

        Returns:
        StaticBoard StaticBoard clone, of the current instance.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        Draws the current generation. Visualisation of the gameboard to the user, using Canvas's GraphicsContext support
        Specified by:
        draw in class Gameboard

      • displayNextGen

        public void displayNextGen()
        Looping through calcNextGen and draw(). Animating the gameboard visualy for the user.
        Specified by:
        displayNextGen in class Gameboard

      • changeCellStatus

        public void changeCellStatus(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent e)
        User is able to change the cell state with mouse impact. Right-clicks or drags creates living cells. Left-click or drags eliminates living cells.
        Specified by:
        changeCellStatus in class Gameboard
        Parameters:
        e - e MouseEvent parameter given by the controller.

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Resets the current generation, and the Canvas. Eliminating all living cells.
        Specified by:
        resetBoard in class Gameboard

      • updateBoardWithPattern

        public void updateBoardWithPattern(byte[][] input)
        Initiates pattern placement for loaded patterns.
        Parameters:
        input - input is the pattern represented as a byte[][].
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.setStartIndexLoaded(), PatternLoader.drawLoaded()

      • setStartIndexLoaded

        public void setStartIndexLoaded()
        Setter for start index to loaded pattern. This is where the pattern placement sequence starts. It is set to start at the middle of the current generation (currentGen) pattern.
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.moveLoaded(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent), PatternLoader.drawLoaded(), PatternLoader.glueLoaded()

      • glueLoaded

        public void glueLoaded()
        Attaches the loaded pattern to the current generation.

      • boundingBox

        public int[] boundingBox(byte[][] input)
        Gives the border limits of the current living cells.
        Parameters:
        input - input the byte[][] being checked
        Returns:
        int[] int[] containing min width, max width, min height, max height.

      • changeBoardSize

        public void changeBoardSize()
        Allows the user to choose a StaticBoard size, this method will also reset the current generation, leaving a completely dead generation. If the user inputs a non-digit value, a NumberFormatException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        changeBoardSize in class Gameboard

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • drawLoaded

        public void drawLoaded()
        Draws the pattern loaded in by user, either through URL or as a RLE file. Uses 2D representation to load pattern. Every living cell is set to grey and every dead cell is transparent.
        See Also:
        PatternLoader.glueLoaded()

      • rotateLoaded

        public void rotateLoaded()
        Description copied from interface: PatternLoader
        Allows the user to rotate the loaded pattern. Transforming the pattern to rotated by creating a new pattern.
